section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: adjournment (押後), in relation to a poll or the counting of the votes in respect of a poll, means an adjournment under section 21(2) of the Election Ordinance or section 61(2), and adjourned (押後) shall be construed accordingly; (E.R. 2 of 2020)
Assistant Presiding Officer (助理投票站主任) means a polling officer designated as an Assistant Presiding Officer under section 20(2);
Assistant Returning Officer (助理選舉主任) means an Assistant Returning Officer appointed under section 41(3) of the Election Ordinance;
ballot paper account (選票結算表) means a statement prepared under section 42;
Candidate Eligibility Review Committee (候選人資格審查委員會) means the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee established under section 9A of the Election Ordinance; (14 of 2021 s. 228)
contested election (有競逐選舉) means an election in which there are 2 or more candidates; (L.N. 209 of 2006)
counting agent (監察點票代理人) means a counting agent appointed under section 44;
counting station (點票站) means a counting station designated under section 18;
dedicated polling station (專用投票站) means a place designated as a dedicated polling station under section 18(1); (L.N. 133 of 2009)
Deputy Presiding Officer (副投票站主任) means a polling officer designated as the Deputy Presiding Officer under section 20(2);
election (選舉) means an election held under section 6 of the Election Ordinance;

def.name: ElectionAdvertisement
def.leadIn: election advertisement (選舉廣告), in relation to an election, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a publicly exhibited notice, leaflet, circular, bill, booklet, placard or poster;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice, leaflet, circular, bill, booklet, placard or poster delivered by hand or electronic transmission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a public announcement made by radio or television or by video or cinematographic film; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other form of publication,

def.continued: published for the purpose of promoting or prejudicing the election of a candidate or candidates at the election; (11 of 2012 s. 15)

subsection.def: election agent (選舉代理人) means an election agent appointed under section 12;
election expense agent (選舉開支代理人) means an election expense agent appointed under section 13;

election expenses (選舉開支) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554), but the reference to “an election” in that meaning shall be construed as a reference to an election defined in this section; (L.N. 279 of 2001)
Election Ordinance (《選舉條例》) means the Chief Executive Election Ordinance (Cap. 569);
elector (選民) means a member of the Election Committee constituted under section 8 of the Election Ordinance who is not disqualified under section 26 of the Election Ordinance from voting;
electoral officer (選舉事務人員) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance and includes a Presiding Officer, a polling officer and a counting officer; (L.N. 133 of 2009)
final register (正式委員登記冊) means the final register of members of the Election Committee published under section 40(2), (3), (3A) or (4) of the Schedule to the Election Ordinance; (L.N. 209 of 2006)
head-dress (頭飾) means anything which is worn on a person’s head; (L.N. 209 of 2006)
identity card (身分證) has the same meaning as it has in the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);

def.name: IdentityDocument
def.leadIn: identity document (身分證明文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an identity card;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a document issued by the Commissioner (within the meaning of section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177)) to a person certifying that the person is exempt, under regulation 25 of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A), from being required to register under that Ordinance; or (1 of 2019 s. 80)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other document issued to a person which is acceptable to the Returning Officer as proof of the person’s identity;

def.name: InCustody
def.leadIn: in custody (受羈押), in relation to a person, means the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serving a sentence of imprisonment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: detained by the Correctional Services Department on remand; or

paragraph.name: c

def.name: LawEnforcementAgency
def.leadIn: law enforcement agency (執法機關) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Customs and Excise Department;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Police Force;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Immigration Department;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Independent Commission Against Corruption; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other department of the Government any officer of which is empowered by any Ordinance to exercise a power of arrest; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.def: main polling station (主投票站) means the place designated as the main polling station under section 18(1); (L.N. 133 of 2009)
maximum security prison (高度設防監獄) means a prison which is specified as a maximum security prison under rule 47A(1)(b) of the Prison Rules (Cap. 234 sub. leg. A); (L.N. 133 of 2009)
member of the Election Committee (選舉委員) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance; (14 of 2021 s. 228)
no canvassing zone (禁止拉票區) means an area determined under section 23 as a no canvassing zone;
no staying zone (禁止逗留區) means an area determined under section 23 as a no staying zone;
nomination period (提名期) means the nomination period fixed under section 15(1) of the Election Ordinance;

def.name: OrdinaryBusinessHours
def.leadIn: ordinary business hours (通常辦公時間) means the hours—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. on any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday (other than a general holiday); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: between 9 a.m. and 12 noon on a Saturday (other than a general holiday) during the period between—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of a notice under section 3 in respect of an election; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of the result of the election under the Election Ordinance or the date of the declaration of the termination of the proceedings for the election under that Ordinance, as may be appropriate; (15 of 2016 s. 70)

subsection.def: poll (投票) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
polling agent (監察投票代理人) means a polling agent appointed under section 25;

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the date fixed in accordance with section 17(3); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date appointed under section 65(1) or (2);

subsection.def: polling hours (投票時間) means the hours for polling appointed under section 17(1), (1A) or (3)(b) or 65(2); (L.N. 209 of 2006)
polling officer (投票站人員) means a polling officer appointed under section 20;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the main polling station; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: postponement (延遲), in relation to a poll or the counting of the votes in respect of a poll, means a postponement under section 21(1) of the Election Ordinance or section 61(1), and postponed (延遲) shall be construed accordingly;
Returning Officer (選舉主任) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Election Ordinance;
spoilt ballot papers (損壞的選票) means a ballot paper endorsed in the manner described in section 40(3);
uncontested election (無競逐選舉) means an election in which at the close of nominations only one candidate is validly nominated; (L.N. 209 of 2006)
verification statement (核實報表) means a statement prepared under section 49(1A)(a)(iii) or 52(1)(d). (1 of 2019 s. 60)

def.name: Candidate
def.leadIn: In this Regulation, the expression candidate (候選人) also means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in sections 5(1), 12, 15 and 21, a person who is being or has been nominated to stand for an election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in sections 13 and 16 and Part 10, a person who has publicly declared an intention to stand for an election at any time before close of nominations; (11 of 2012 s. 15)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in section 14, a person referred to in paragraph (a) or (b).

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Effect of inclement weather warning on date and period

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: gale warning (烈風警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);
inclement weather warning day (惡劣天氣警告日) means a working day on which a gale warning or a rainstorm warning is in force at any time during ordinary business hours;
rainstorm warning (暴雨警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday other than a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a Saturday (other than a general holiday) during the period between—

subparagraph.content: the date of publication of a notice under section 3 in respect of an election; and

the date of publication of the result of the election under the Election Ordinance or the date of the declaration of the termination of the proceedings for the election under that Ordinance, as may be appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a date is prescribed in this Regulation (whether by reference to a specific day of a specific month or to a day otherwise ascertainable under this Regulation) or is fixed under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an act is required or permitted by a provision of this Regulation to be done not later than, or on or before, the date or on the date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the next working day which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the date is taken to be prescribed or fixed in relation to the act instead for the provision.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period is prescribed in or fixed under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an act is required or permitted by a provision of this Regulation to be done in, during or within the period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the last day of the period falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the period is extended, in relation to the act, to end on the next working day which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the day mentioned in paragraph (c), and the provision has effect accordingly.

subsection.content: Subsections (2) and (3) are subject to section 65.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Notice relating to submission of nomination forms
section.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the publication of a notice under section 12 of the Election Ordinance, the Chief Electoral Officer shall publish in the Gazette a notice which states—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nomination period fixed under section 15(1) of the Election Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the office of the Returning Officer at which nomination forms must be delivered;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that nomination forms must be delivered during ordinary business hours; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that a poll will be conducted on the polling date if any candidate is validly nominated. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

section.name: s4
section.heading: How to nominate a candidate

subsection.leadIn: A nomination form nominating a person as a candidate shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: contain a declaration by the person that he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is eligible to be;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is not disqualified from being; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: consents to be,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contain the name as shown on the identity document and identity document number of the person and each member of the Election Committee making the nomination; (L.N. 279 of 2001)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: be signed by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a holder of an identity document who has attained the age of 18 years as the witness to the signature of the person; and (L.N. 279 of 2001)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: each member of the Election Committee making the nomination; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: be delivered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: during ordinary business hours at the address stated in the notice published under section 3;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by the person in person or in any other manner authorized by the Returning Officer; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: together with the declarations referred to in section 16(7) of the Election Ordinance.

subsection.content: A nomination form nominating a person as a candidate may include a name of the person which is different from that shown on his identity document if the Returning Officer is satisfied that the person is usually known by that name. (L.N. 279 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer may require a person who is nominated as a candidate to furnish any other information that the Officer considers appropriate for enabling the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to be satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the person is eligible to be nominated as a candidate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise as to the validity of the nomination. (14 of 2021 s. 229)

subsection.content: The provisions of this section are made for the purposes of section 16 of the Election Ordinance.

section.name: s4A
section.heading: Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to decide whether candidates are validly nominated

subsection.content: The Returning Officer must, as soon as practicable after receiving a nomination form, forward the form to the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee.
The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must, as soon as practicable after receiving a nomination form forwarded by the Returning Officer, decide whether a candidate is validly nominated.

subsection.leadIn: If sections 13, 14 and 16 of the Election Ordinance and section 4 are complied with in relation to a candidate, the candidate stands validly nominated unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee decides that the nomination form is invalid; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the candidate withdraws his or her candidature.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to sections 13, 14 and 16 of the Election Ordinance, the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee may decide that a nomination is invalid if and only if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nomination form has not been completed or signed as required under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee is satisfied that the candidate is not eligible to be, or is disqualified from being, nominated as a candidate under the Election Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer is satisfied that the candidate is dead.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether a candidate is validly nominated, the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may require the Returning Officer to advise the Committee, and have regard to such advice of the Returning Officer, as to any of the matters specified in subsection (6); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may require the candidate to furnish any other information that the Committee considers appropriate to be satisfied as to the validity of the nomination.

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for subsection (5)(a) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (7), whether, in the opinion of the Returning Officer, sections 13, 14 and 16 of the Election Ordinance and section 4 are complied with in relation to the candidate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether, in the opinion of the Returning Officer, the nomination form of the candidate is valid;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the candidate has withdrawn candidature;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: whether the nomination form of the candidate has been completed or signed as required under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: in the opinion of the Returning Officer—

subparagraph.content: whether the candidate is eligible to be nominated as a candidate under the Election Ordinance; and
whether the candidate is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate under that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: whether, according to the information available to the Returning Officer, the candidate is dead.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (6)(a), the Returning Officer is not to advise on whether a candidate has complied with section 16(7)(a)(ii) of the Election Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to section 13, 14 or 16 of the Election Ordinance being complied with in relation to a candidate is to be construed as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for section 13 of that Ordinance—that the candidate is eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election under that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for section 14 of that Ordinance—that the candidate is not disqualified from being nominated as a candidate at an election under that section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for section 16 of that Ordinance—that the candidate has complied with that section.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Returning Officer may give opportunity to rectify a nomination form

subsection.leadIn: If the Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: detects on a nomination form an error or omission or anything which may affect the validity of the nomination form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: considers that it can be rectified within the nomination period,

subsection.continued: he may, before forming an opinion for the purposes of section 4A(5)(a) and (6)(b) as to whether the nomination form is valid, give the candidate a reasonable opportunity to rectify it. (14 of 2021 s. 231)

subsection.content: A nomination form cannot be rectified under this section after the close of nominations.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Candidate Eligibility Review Committee to endorse invalid nomination forms

subsection.content: If the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee determines that a nomination form or the nomination of a candidate is invalid, the Committee must endorse on the nomination form the determination and the reasons for it.
The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must sign an endorsement under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must, after deciding whether a person is validly nominated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the Returning Officer of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: return the nomination form to the Returning Officer for retention. (14 of 2021 s. 232)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Returning Officer to notify determination of validity of nomination

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee has determined that a person is validly nominated as a candidate or is not so nominated, send a written notice of the determination to the person and to each validly nominated candidate. (14 of 2021 s. 233)
A notice under subsection (1) shall be sent to the address of the person concerned contained in the nomination form.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Nomination forms to be available for inspection

subsection.leadIn: A copy of each of the nomination forms received by the Returning Officer shall be made available for inspection by the public— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: free of charge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at an office of the Returning Officer specified by him; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: during ordinary business hours,

subsection.continued: until the publication of the relevant result or until the termination of the proceedings for the election under section 22(1AA), (1AB)(e), (1) or (3)(e) of the Election Ordinance. (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 76 of 2011)

def.name: PublicationOfTheRelevantResult
def.leadIn: In subsection (1), publication of the relevant result (刊登有關結果) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publication of the result of the poll in the Gazette under section 22 of the Election Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publication of the result of the election in the Gazette under section 28 of the Election Ordinance,

section.name: s9
section.heading: Withdrawal of candidature

subsection.content: A withdrawal of candidature under section 19 of the Election Ordinance shall be effected by delivering a notice of withdrawal to the Returning Officer before the close of nominations.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of withdrawal shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: bear the signature of the candidate which shall be attested by a witness and bear the witness’ signature; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: be delivered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the candidate in person or his election agent in person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at an office of the Returning Officer specified by him; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: during ordinary business hours.

subsection.content: The provisions of this section are made for the purposes of section 19 of the Election Ordinance.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Notice of termination of election proceedings

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after terminating the proceedings for the election under section 22(1AA), (1AB)(e), (1) or (3)(e) of the Election Ordinance, publish a notice of the termination of proceedings. (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 76 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be signed by the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state the reasons for and the date and time of the termination; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be published in the Gazette or in such newspaper circulating daily in Hong Kong as the Returning Officer considers appropriate.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Election Agents and Election Expense Agents

section.name: s12
section.heading: Appointment of election agent

subsection.content: A candidate may appoint one person as his election agent. (L.N. 209 of 2006)
Only a holder of an identity card who has attained the age of 18 years may be appointed as an election agent.

subsection.leadIn: An election agent appointed by a candidate may do all things which the candidate may do or is required to do under this Regulation in connection with an election except— (15 of 2016 s. 59)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making a declaration referred to in section 16(7) of the Election Ordinance or section 4(1)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: signing on a nomination form as the candidate being nominated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signing on a notice of withdrawal of candidature referred to in section 19 of the Election Ordinance as the candidate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: appointing an election agent under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: appointing an election expense agent under section 13;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: without prejudice to section 13, incurring election expenses on behalf of the candidate; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: revoking the appointment of an election agent or election expense agent under section 14(4); (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (i), being present in a dedicated polling station situated in a prison unless, on an application in the specified form delivered by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission to the Chief Electoral Officer at least one week before the polling date, the Commissioner of Correctional Services consents to his presence; or (L.N. 133 of 2009; 15 of 2016 s. 43)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: being present in a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison. (L.N. 133 of 2009; L.N. 197 of 2009)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Correctional Services must not give consent to an election agent under subsection (3)(h) in respect of a polling station if a polling agent has been appointed under section 25 by the same candidate for that polling station. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (3)(h), the Commissioner of Correctional Services may, on an application made under that subsection during the week before the polling date, give consent under that subsection if he is satisfied that— (15 of 2016 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector in custody who is entitled to vote at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is admitted or transferred to the prison during that week; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is made without undue delay after the admission or transfer. (L.N. 133 of 2009; 15 of 2016 s. 43)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.content: If the Commissioner of Correctional Services refuses to give consent under subsection (3)(h), he must notify the candidate or the election agent as soon as practicable. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

Subject to subsection (3), any act which purports to be done by an election agent in his capacity as such on behalf of the candidate who appointed him shall be as effective as if it had been done by the candidate in person.
A notice under section 15(1), 23(2) or (4), 31(4) or 43(3) given to the election agent of a candidate shall be regarded as having been given to the candidate.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Appointment of election expense agent

subsection.content: A candidate may appoint as his election expense agent any number of person who has attained the age of 18 years. (L.N. 209 of 2006)
An election expense agent appointed by a candidate shall, by virtue of the appointment, be authorized to incur election expenses on behalf of the candidate as his agent.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Provisions applicable to appointment of agents

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: agent (代理人) means an election agent or election expense agent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to the Returning Officer shall be construed as a reference to the Chief Electoral Officer if the Returning Officer has not been appointed.

subsection.content: An appointment of an agent shall be effected by giving a notice of appointment to the Returning Officer.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appointment shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be delivered to the Returning Officer by hand, by electronic mail, by facsimile transmission or (except a notice of an appointment made on the polling date) by post; (15 of 2016 s. 44)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name and address of the agent;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: state—

subparagraph.content: for an election agent—the identity card number of the agent; and
for an election expense agent—the identity document number of the agent; and (1 of 2019 s. 84)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: be signed by the candidate and the agent.

subsection.content: The appointment of an agent may be revoked by giving a notice of revocation to the Returning Officer.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of revocation shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivered to the Returning Officer by hand, by electronic mail, by facsimile transmission or (except a notice of a revocation of appointment made on the polling date) by post; (15 of 2016 s. 44)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in specified form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the candidate.

subsection.content: If an agent dies or the appointment of an agent is revoked, the candidate may, subject to this Part, appoint another person as an agent to replace the first-mentioned agent.
The appointment of or revocation of the appointment of an agent is not effective until the notice of appointment or notice of revocation, as the case may be, is received by the Returning Officer.
The Returning Officer shall display in a prominent place immediately outside his office a notice of the particulars of the election agents.

subsection.leadIn: All notices of appointment of election expense agent given by any candidate under subsection (2) shall be made available for inspection by the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: free of charge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at an office of the Returning Officer specified by him; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: during ordinary business hours,

subsection.continued: until the end of the period during which the copy of the election return lodged by the candidate is available for inspection under section 41 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).

section.name: s15
section.heading: Other candidates to be notified of particulars of election agent

subsection.content: After receiving a notice of appointment of an election agent by a candidate, the Returning Officer shall send a notice in specified form to every other candidate.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the name and address of the agent; and (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be sent as soon as practicable after the receipt of the notice of appointment.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Limit of expenses for election expense agent

subsection.content: A candidate who appoints an election expense agent shall set the maximum amount of election expenses that the agent may incur on his behalf.
The amount set under subsection (1) by a candidate in relation to an election expense agent shall be specified in the notice of appointment of the agent.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Appointment of polling hours

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (8) and (9), in a contested election, the hours during which electors can vote in the first 3 rounds of voting on the polling date shall be appointed by the Chief Electoral Officer. (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subject to subsections (8) and (9), in an uncontested election, the hours during which electors can vote on the polling date shall be appointed by the Chief Electoral Officer. (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 133 of 2009)
The Chief Electoral Officer shall, at least 10 days before the polling date, publish in the Gazette a notice specifying the polling hours appointed under subsection (1) or (1A). (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: If in a contested election the voting has to proceed to the fourth or any subsequent round— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any such round of voting shall, subject to subsection (4), be conducted on the day following the polling date on which the first 3 rounds of voting are conducted or, if the operation of section 27 of the Election Ordinance so requires, day after day thereafter until a candidate is returned or until the election proceedings are terminated under section 22(3)(e) of the Election Ordinance; and (L.N. 76 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer shall appoint the hours during which electors can vote in such round.

subsection.content: Not more than 3 rounds of voting shall be conducted under subsection (3)(a) on each day.

The Chief Electoral Officer shall, as soon as practicable after the appointment of polling hours under subsection (3)(b) for a polling date fixed under subsection (3)(a), announce the polling date and polling hours through radio or television broadcast.
The Chief Electoral Officer shall appoint the polling hours so as to give the electors a reasonable opportunity to vote.
The Chief Electoral Officer may appoint different polling hours for different polling stations. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

The Commissioner of Correctional Services may assign a time slot during the polling hours appointed for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison to an elector in custody to whom the polling station is allocated under section 18A. (L.N. 133 of 2009)
Subject to section 35, an elector to whom a time slot is assigned under subsection (8) may only cast his vote during the time slot. (L.N. 133 of 2009)
The Commissioner of Correctional Services must assign the time slot so as to give the electors a reasonable opportunity to vote. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

The Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as early as practicable before the commencement of the poll, notify all electors to whom time slots are assigned under subsection (8) of the time slot assigned to each of them. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Designation of polling station and counting station

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer shall designate, by notice published in the Gazette at least 10 days before the polling date— (15 of 2016 s. 64)

paragraph.name: a
aa
paragraph.content: one or more places as a dedicated polling station or dedicated polling stations at which electors in custody are allocated to vote; and (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a place as the counting station for counting of the votes cast in the election.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer may designate under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any premises occupied by a Government department for official purposes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other premises hired under subsection (3).

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may hire any premises for use as a polling station or the counting station. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If any premises hired under subsection (3) are used as a polling station or the counting station, the Chief Electoral Officer shall— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make good any damage to the premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: defray any expenses incurred by any person having control over the premises,

subsection.continued: due to their having been so used.

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may take such steps as he considers appropriate, including taking out insurance, to insure against any risk of loss or damage that may arise due to or in connection with the use of any premises as a polling station or counting station. (L.N. 133 of 2009)
A designation under subsection (1) may be made by reference to a map or plan.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer shall display the relevant map or plan referred to in subsection (6)— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a prominent place immediately outside the main polling station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a prominent place inside a dedicated polling station; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in a prominent place immediately outside the counting station. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Allocation of polling stations to electors in custody

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may allocate to an elector who will be serving a sentence of imprisonment on the polling date a dedicated polling station to cast the vote he is entitled to cast at an election.

The Chief Electoral Officer may, if the circumstances require, allocate to an elector in custody an alternative polling station, in addition to or in substitution of the main polling station or the polling station allocated under subsection (1), to cast the vote he is entitled to cast at an election.

subsection.leadIn: To enable the Chief Electoral Officer to perform his or her functions under this section in relation to electors, the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, upon a request by the Chief Electoral Officer, provide the following information concerning every person who is serving a sentence of imprisonment or detained by the Correctional Services Department on remand—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the person’s identity document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prisoner registration number allocated by the Commissioner of Correctional Services to the person for identification purposes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name and address of the premises in which the person is detained. (L.N. 76 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: To enable the Chief Electoral Officer to perform his or her functions under this section in relation to electors, the head of any law enforcement agency must, upon a request by the Chief Electoral Officer, provide the following information concerning every person who is detained by the law enforcement agency under any lawful authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the person’s identity document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name and address of the premises in which the person is detained. (L.N. 76 of 2011)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Polling notice to electors

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the Chief Electoral Officer shall send a polling notice in specified form to every elector.

subsection.leadIn: A polling notice shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the polling date and the polling hours; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.leadIn: also state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the address of the main polling station;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if it is sent to an elector who will be serving a sentence of imprisonment on the polling date, the address of the dedicated polling station allocated to him under section 18A; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a location map of the polling station;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: detailed voting instructions; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: details of the polling and counting procedures; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be sent at least 10 days before the polling date.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A polling notice sent to an elector who will be serving a sentence of imprisonment in a prison on the polling date must be addressed to the elector and sent, as far as practicable, to the prison. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

If the polling date is fixed under section 17(3), the Chief Electoral Officer may dispense with the polling notice and announce the polling date, the polling hours and the addresses of the polling stations through radio or television broadcast. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Electoral Officer allocates an alternative polling station to an elector under section 18A(2), that Officer shall, as soon as practicable, notify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the elector;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the polling station previously allocated to the elector; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the alternative polling station. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Appointment of Presiding Officer and polling officers

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer may appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Presiding Officer to preside at each polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such number of polling officers as he thinks fit to assist the Presiding Officer in the conduct of a poll.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may, with reasonable cause, revoke at any time any appointment made under subsection (1). (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Electoral Officer may designate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a polling officer as the Deputy Presiding Officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any polling officer as an Assistant Presiding Officer.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer of a polling station shall display a list of the names of the polling officers and himself in a prominent place— (L.N. 76 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if the polling station is not a dedicated polling station) immediately outside the polling station; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the polling station is a dedicated polling station) inside the polling station. (L.N. 76 of 2011)

subsection.content: A Presiding Officer may perform any act which he is required or authorized to perform under this Regulation through a polling officer.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Copy of final register to be supplied to candidates

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer shall, as soon as practicable after a nomination form nominating a candidate is delivered to the Returning Officer, supply to the candidate a copy of the final register.
The Chief Electoral Officer shall, as soon as practicable after making a declaration under section 18(1) of the Election Ordinance, supply to the Returning Officer a copy of the final register.
The Chief Electoral Officer may add to the copy of the final register supplied under subsection (1) or (2) such particulars or information as he thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Copies of the final register may be supplied in any or all of the following form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a printed form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a non-legible form which is capable of being reproduced in a legible form by using a computer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other form determined by the Chief Electoral Officer.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Miscellaneous arrangements relating to voting

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer shall provide at each polling station sufficient compartments to enable electors to mark and fold ballot papers issued to them, screened from observation.
The Chief Electoral Officer shall supply to each Presiding Officer such number of ballot papers he considers necessary for the polling.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer shall display a notice providing information on voting procedure for the guidance of electors—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a prominent place immediately outside the main polling station;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: in a prominent place inside a dedicated polling station; and (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inside every compartment provided under subsection (1).

section.name: s23
section.heading: Determination of no canvassing zone and no staying zone

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall, by reference to a map or plan, determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any area outside a polling station as a no canvassing zone; and (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any area within a no canvassing zone as a no staying zone.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall give a notice indicating the boundary of the no canvassing zone and no staying zone to every candidate at least 7 days before the polling date. (L.N. 209 of 2006)
The Returning Officer may vary a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone.

subsection.leadIn: If a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone is varied, the Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after the variation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a notice indicating the boundary of the zone as varied to every candidate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: display a copy of such notice at or near the polling station.

subsection.content: On the polling date, the Returning Officer shall display at or near each polling station a notice indicating the boundary of the no canvassing zone and the no staying zone as determined or, where applicable, as varied. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: The Returning Officer may perform any act which he is required or authorized to perform under subsections (3), (4) and (5) through a Presiding Officer. (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 133 of 2009)
A determination under subsection (1) comes into effect upon the display of a notice under subsection (5) in relation to the no canvassing zone and no staying zone as determined.
A variation under subsection (3) comes into effect upon the display of a notice under subsection (5) in relation to the no canvassing zone or no staying zone as varied.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Order in no canvassing zone and no staying zone

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer shall keep order at any no canvassing zone or no staying zone.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: engage in canvassing for votes in a no canvassing zone;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: conduct any activity for canvassing for votes so that the sound of the activity can be heard in the no canvassing zone; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3A), use a sound amplifying system or device for any purpose in the no canvassing zone without lawful authority; (L.N. 76 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use a sound amplifying system or device, for canvassing for votes, so that the sound emitted by it can be heard in the no canvassing zone;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, display in the no canvassing zone any propaganda material relating to any candidate or the election of the Chief Executive; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: stay or loiter in the no staying zone without the express permission of the Presiding Officer,

subsection.continued: on the polling date.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the following acts shall fall within “canvassing for votes”—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a contested election, suggesting not to vote for any candidate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, suggesting not to vote in support of the candidate. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: An officer of the Correctional Services Department may, on the polling date, use a sound amplifying system or device for the performance of his or her duties in the no canvassing zone of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison. (L.N. 76 of 2011; 15 of 2016 s. 71)

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fail to comply with a lawful direction given by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause an obstruction to any person who is in the zone and on his way to vote; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise misconduct himself,

subsection.continued: in a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone on the polling date.

subsection.leadIn: If a person contravenes subsection (2) or (4), the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the person to produce his identity card for inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order the person to leave the zone immediately.

subsection.content: No person shall fail to produce his identity card when required to do so under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to leave when ordered to do so under subsection (5), he may be removed by— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a police officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the no canvassing zone or the no staying zone, as may be appropriate, is determined in relation to a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.content: No person who is removed under subsection (7) shall enter the relevant zone again on the polling date without the express permission of the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer.
The powers conferred by subsections (5) and (7) shall not be so exercised as to prevent an elector from voting.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Polling agents

subsection.leadIn: A candidate may appoint— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not more than 3 persons as the candidate’s polling agents for the main polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one person as the candidate’s polling agent for each dedicated polling station not situated in a maximum security prison. (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no polling agent may be appointed by a candidate for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison if the Commissioner of Correctional Services has consented under section 12(3)(h) to the presence of the election agent of that candidate in that polling station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no polling agent may be appointed for a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.content: A polling agent appointed by a candidate may attend at the polling station on behalf of the candidate for any purpose connected with the conduct of a poll.
Only a holder of an identity card who has attained the age of 18 years may be appointed as a polling agent.

subsection.leadIn: An appointment of a polling agent is effective only if a notice of appointment is delivered to— (L.N. 133 of 2009; 15 of 2016 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission at least 7 days before the polling date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer of the polling station by the candidate, or the election agent of the candidate, in person on the polling date. (15 of 2016 s. 45)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (1) and (4), the appointment of a polling agent for a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is not effective unless— (L.N. 133 of 2009; 15 of 2016 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of appointment is given in accordance with subsection (4)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner of Correctional Services consents to the appointment. (15 of 2016 s. 45)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (4A), even though a notice of appointment is given during the week before the polling date, the Commissioner of Correctional Services may still give consent under that subsection if he is satisfied that— (15 of 2016 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector in custody who is entitled to vote at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison is admitted or transferred to the prison during that week; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notice of appointment is given without undue delay after the admission or transfer. (L.N. 133 of 2009; 15 of 2016 s. 45)

subsection.name: 4C
subsection.content: If the Commissioner of Correctional Services refuses to give consent under subsection (4A), he must notify the candidate or his election agent as soon as practicable. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appointment shall—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name, identity card number and address of the polling agent; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be signed by the candidate and the polling agent.

subsection.content: The appointment of a polling agent may be revoked by giving a notice of revocation to the Chief Electoral Officer or the Presiding Officer of the polling station in accordance with subsection (7A) or (7B). (L.N. 133 of 2009; L.N. 76 of 2011; 15 of 2016 s. 45)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of revocation shall be—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in specified form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the candidate.

subsection.name: 7A
subsection.content: If the notice of revocation is given before the polling date, it must be delivered to the Chief Electoral Officer by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (15 of 2016 s. 45)

subsection.name: 7B
subsection.leadIn: If the notice of revocation is given on the polling date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the polling agent is appointed is not a dedicated polling station situated in a prison) it must be delivered to the Presiding Officer of the polling station by the candidate, or the election agent of the candidate, in person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the polling station for which the polling agent is appointed is a dedicated polling station situated in a prison) it must be delivered to the Chief Electoral Officer by hand, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (15 of 2016 s. 45)

subsection.content: If the appointment of a polling agent is revoked, the candidate may, subject to this section, appoint another person as a polling agent to replace the first-mentioned agent.

The appointment of or revocation of the appointment of a polling agent is not effective until the notice of appointment or notice of revocation, as the case may be, is received by the Chief Electoral Officer or the Presiding Officer.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Admission to polling station

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (1A) and (1B), only— (L.N. 133 of 2009; L.N. 76 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a polling officer;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a candidate;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an election agent;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: an elector;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a polling agent;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a public officer on duty at the polling station;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: a member of Civil Aid Service on duty at the polling station;

paragraph.name: la
lb
m
paragraph.content: a child with permission granted under subsection (2); (14 of 2021 s. 234)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: a person authorized under subsection (3); or (14 of 2021 s. 234)

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: an individual who provides the assistance mentioned in section 93(2)(c) pursuant to an authorization under that section, (14 of 2021 s. 234)

subsection.continued: may enter or stay in a polling station.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The following provisions apply in relation to a dedicated polling station not situated in a maximum security prison—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a candidate is present in the polling station, the election agent or the polling agent of that candidate may not be present in that polling station at the same time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a candidate, an election agent or a polling agent may be present in the polling station subject to the availability of seats in the area designated for accommodating them;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person referred to in paragraph (b) who wishes to enter the polling station must, on arriving at the polling station, report in person to the Presiding Officer and produce his identity card and a declaration of secrecy in the specified form completed by him. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: The following provisions apply in relation to a dedicated polling station situated in a maximum security prison—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an election agent may not be present in the polling station;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: a candidate may be present in the polling station subject to the availability of any seat in the area designated for accommodating the candidate; (L.N. 76 of 2011)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a candidate who wishes to enter the polling station must, on arriving at the polling station, report in person to the Presiding Officer and produce his identity card and a declaration of secrecy in the specified form completed by him. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector arrives at the main polling station for the purpose of voting accompanied by a child; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Presiding Officer considers that the child—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: should not be left unattended while the elector is in the polling station; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: will not disturb or cause inconvenience to any person in the polling station,

subsection.continued: the Presiding Officer may grant permission for the child to enter the polling station.

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer or a member of the Commission may authorize any person in writing to enter and stay in a polling station in accordance with the terms of the authorization.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Order in polling station

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer of a polling station shall keep order at the polling station. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: communicate with any elector; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use a mobile telephone, paging machine or any other communication device to communicate with any other person,

subsection.continued: in a polling station during the polling hours contrary to a direction of the Returning Officer, Assistant Returning Officer, Presiding Officer or any polling officer not to do so. (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a Presiding Officer; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a polling officer;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a public officer on duty at the polling station;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a member of the Civil Aid Service on duty at the polling station; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: ha
paragraph.content: a police officer on duty at the polling station; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: hb
paragraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer to act as a liaison officer; or (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a person authorized by the Chief Electoral Officer or a member of the Commission in writing to do an act prohibited by subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: film;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take photograph; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make any audio or video recording,

subsection.continued: in a polling station on the polling date without the express permission of—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: engage in canvassing for votes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, display any propaganda material relating to any candidate or the election of the Chief Executive,

subsection.continued: in a polling station on the polling date. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5), the following acts shall fall within “canvassing for votes”—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a contested election, suggesting not to vote for any candidate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, suggesting not to vote in support of the candidate. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fail to comply with a lawful direction given by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disrupt the poll;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: disturb or cause inconvenience to any person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: otherwise misconduct himself,

subsection.continued: in a polling station on the polling date. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.name: 7A
subsection.content: If an elector who is allocated to vote at a dedicated polling station fails to cast his vote without undue delay in accordance with section 36(1), the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may order him to leave the polling station immediately. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If a person contravenes subsection (5), (7) or (7A), the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer may— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the person to produce his identity card for inspection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order the person to leave the polling station immediately.

subsection.content: No person shall fail to produce his identity card when required to do so under subsection (8).

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to leave a polling station under subsection (7A) or (8), he may be removed— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the main polling station, by a police officer or by a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a dedicated polling station, by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer, as may be appropriate;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an officer of the Correctional Services Department; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an officer of any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.content: A person who is removed under subsection (10) may not enter the polling station again on the polling date without the express permission of the Returning Officer or the Presiding Officer.
The powers conferred by subsections (8) and (10) shall not be so exercised as to prevent an elector from voting.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Ballot Box, Ballot Papers and Voting Procedure

section.name: s28
section.heading: Design of ballot box
section.content: A ballot box to be used in a poll shall be so constructed that ballot papers can be put into it while it is locked but cannot be withdrawn from it without unlocking it and breaking the sealing device used to seal it.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Ballot box to be sealed before commencement of poll

subsection.content: Immediately before the commencement of the poll, the Presiding Officer shall show the ballot box, empty, to the persons who are present within the polling station.

The Presiding Officer shall, after showing the ballot box under subsection (1), lock it and seal it with a sealing device provided for that purpose by the Chief Electoral Officer so that it cannot be opened without unlocking the lock and breaking the sealing device.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: place the ballot box for the receipt of ballot papers in the view of a polling officer or himself; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that the ballot box is kept locked and sealed while it is in his custody.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Form of ballot papers

subsection.content: A ballot paper to be used in a contested election shall be in Form 1 in the Schedule. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A ballot paper to be used in an uncontested election shall be in Form 2 in the Schedule. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may decide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the colour of ballot papers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the design, if any, printed on the back of ballot papers; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to have ballot papers to be used in different rounds of voting printed in different colours.

subsection.content: A number may be printed on the counterfoil of a ballot paper, but that number shall not be printed or shown in any manner on the ballot paper.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Order of names of candidates in contested election on ballot papers

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: This section applies to a contested election. (L.N. 209 of 2006)
A number shall be allocated to each candidate by the drawing of lots conducted by the Returning Officer.
The names of the candidates shall appear on a ballot paper in the order of the numbers allocated under subsection (1).
The number allocated to a candidate shall be printed on the ballot papers against his name.
The Chief Electoral Officer shall give notice to each candidate of the arrangements for the drawing of lots under subsection (1).
A candidate or his election agent may be present at the drawing of lots under subsection (1).

section.name: s32
section.heading: Question to person applying for a ballot paper

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer may, in case of doubt and at the time a person applies for a ballot paper, ask the person any appropriate question set out in any paragraph of subsection (2). (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: The questions referred to in subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any election—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: “你是否已登記在選舉委員會正式委員登記冊上，而有關登記記項一如以下所述 (the Presiding Officer to read the Chinese version of the whole entry as it is recorded in the final register)?”; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: “Are you the person registered in the Election Committee final register as follows (the Presiding Officer to read the English version of the whole entry as it is recorded in the final register)?”; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a contested election—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: “你是否已在這一輪投票中投了票?”; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: “Have you already cast a vote in this round of voting?”; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an uncontested election—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: “你是否已投了票?”; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: “Have you already cast a vote?”. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer must ask the appropriate question set out in subsection (2) if so required by a candidate, an election agent or a polling agent.
The Presiding Officer shall not issue a ballot paper to any person who fails to answer the questions asked of that person under this section to the satisfaction of that Officer.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Challenging a person who has applied for a ballot paper or who has voted

subsection.leadIn: If a candidate, an election agent or a polling agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: declares to the Presiding Officer that he has reasonable cause to believe that a person has engaged in corrupt conduct of impersonation referred to in section 15 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: undertakes in writing to substantiate the allegation in a court,

subsection.continued: the Presiding Officer may take the step specified in subsection (3A).

subsection.leadIn: A declaration referred to in subsection (1)(a) may only be made—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the time the person applies for the ballot paper; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: after the person has applied for a ballot paper; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before the person has left the polling station.

subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer has reason to believe that a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who applies for or has applied for a ballot paper; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who has not left the polling station,

subsection.continued: has engaged in corrupt conduct of impersonation referred to in section 15 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554), the Presiding Officer may take the step specified in subsection (3A).

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: The step specified for the purposes of subsections (1) and (3) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the main polling station, requesting a police officer to arrest the person concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a dedicated polling station, requesting an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency to remove the person concerned from the polling station and report the case to the police. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: A person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of whom a declaration is made under subsection (1) (whether or not he is arrested or removed under that subsection); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who has been arrested or removed pursuant to a request made under subsection (3),

subsection.continued: shall not be prevented from voting only by reason of the declaration, arrest or removal. (L.N. 76 of 2011)

section.name: s34
section.heading: Issue of ballot paper

subsection.leadIn: If a person applies for a ballot paper at the issuing desk, the polling officer manning the desk shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon being satisfied, by inspecting the document or documents set out in subsection (1A) or (1B), that the person is an elector registered in the final register; and (L.N. 132 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after calling out the name of the person as stated in the copy of the final register in that officer’s possession,

subsection.continued: issue to the person one ballot paper and a chop for marking the ballot paper.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: For a person applying for a ballot paper at a polling station (other than a dedicated polling station situated in a prison), the document or documents referred to in subsection (1)(a) are any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s identity card; (L.N. 151 of 2018)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: a document issued by the Commissioner (within the meaning of section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177)) (Commissioner of Registration) to the person certifying that the person is exempt, under regulation 25 of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A), from being required to register under that Ordinance; (L.N. 151 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a document issued by the Commissioner of Registration acknowledging that the person has applied—

subparagraph.content: to be registered under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); or

paragraph.name: c
d
e
f
paragraph.leadIn: both— (L.N. 151 of 2018)

subparagraph.content: a document evidencing a report to a police officer of the loss or destruction of the document referred to in paragraph (a), (ab) or (b); and (L.N. 151 of 2018)
a valid passport or similar travel document (not being one referred to in another paragraph in this subsection) issued to the person showing the person’s name and photograph. (L.N. 151 of 2018)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: For a person applying for a ballot paper at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison, the document referred to in subsection (1)(a) is a document issued by the Commissioner of Correctional Services showing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s photograph; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prisoner registration number allocated by that Commissioner to the person for identification purposes. (L.N. 132 of 2017)

subsection.content: A person shall not be prevented from voting only due to an omission or inaccuracy of a particular required to be registered in the final register, other than the omission of both his name and the identity document number.

subsection.leadIn: If a ballot paper is issued to an elector, the polling officer shall, subject to subsection (4), record that a ballot paper has been so issued by one or both of the following means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if a printed copy of the final register is used to record the issue—marking the copy in the polling officer’s possession—

subparagraph.content: by placing a line across the name and identity document number of the elector; or
in such other manner that the Chief Electoral Officer may direct; (14 of 2021 s. 235)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an FR electronic copy or extract (as defined by section 91) is used to record the issue—making, by using an electronic device, a record in the entry relating to the elector in the FR electronic copy or extract. (14 of 2021 s. 235)

subsection.content: No record shall be made of the particular ballot paper or ballot papers issued to an elector.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Elector who has not cast vote may return to cast vote with permission

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector has been issued with a ballot paper in a round of voting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has left the polling station without casting his vote,

subsection.continued: he shall not cast the vote in that round of voting unless—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: before leaving the polling station, he has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: made a request to the Presiding Officer for permission to cast the vote before the close of that round of voting;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: informed the Presiding Officer of his reason for leaving the polling station without casting the vote; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: returned the ballot paper to the Presiding Officer; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Presiding Officer has granted the permission.

subsection.content: If an elector has complied with subsection (1)(c), the Presiding Officer shall grant the requested permission unless he is of the opinion that the request is a manifest abuse of the facilities provided by this section.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Despite subsections (1) and (2), an elector to whom a permission is granted under subsection (1) by a Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison must not cast the vote unless the elector returns to the polling station within the time slot assigned to him under subsection (2B) or section 17(8). (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer of a dedicated polling station situated in a prison grants the permission to an elector under subsection (1), the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as far as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign to the elector a new time slot during the polling hours appointed for the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the elector of the new time slot. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If the Presiding Officer grants the permission to an elector under subsection (2), he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep in his custody the ballot paper returned by the elector under subsection (1)(c)(iii); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the elector’s return to the polling station to cast the vote, re-issue the ballot paper to the elector in the presence of— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of the main polling station, a police officer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.content: If the Presiding Officer does not grant the permission under subsection (2), he shall immediately re-issue to the elector the ballot paper returned under subsection (1)(c)(iii).

subsection.leadIn: An elector who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued with a ballot paper in a round of voting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: becomes incapacitated from voting by physical illness; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: has left the polling station after—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: returning the ballot paper to the Presiding Officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: leaving the ballot paper in the polling station without putting it into the ballot box,

subsection.continued: may return to the polling station and cast his vote before the close of that round of voting.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: If an elector in custody leaves a dedicated polling station situated in a prison under subsection (5), the Commissioner of Correctional Services must, as far as practicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign to the elector a new time slot during the polling hours appointed for the polling station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the elector of the new time slot. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: The right of an elector in custody who is allocated to vote at a dedicated polling station situated in a prison to cast the vote under subsection (5) is subject to his returning to the polling station within the time slot assigned to him under subsection (5A) or section 17(8). (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If a ballot paper is returned under subsection (5)(c)(i) or left in the polling station under subsection (5)(c)(ii) by an elector, the Presiding Officer shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep in his custody the ballot paper; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the elector’s return to the polling station to cast the vote, re-issue the ballot paper to the elector in the presence of— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of the main polling station, a police officer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a dedicated polling station, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or any law enforcement agency. (L.N. 133 of 2009)
