subsection.content: For the purposes of this Regulation, re-issuing a ballot paper under subsection (3), (4) or (6) shall be regarded issuing a ballot paper under section 34(1).
For the purposes of this section, the poll in an uncontested election shall be regarded as a round of voting. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

section.name: s36
section.heading: Voting procedure

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 37(1), when an elector is issued with a ballot paper, he shall, without undue delay—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately go into a compartment provided under section 22(1) in the polling station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: mark the ballot paper in the compartment by affixing the chop issued under section 34(1) to— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a contested election, give a single “✓” in the circle opposite the name of the candidate of his choice on the ballot paper; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, give a single “✓” in the circle opposite the word “SUPPORT” or “NOT SUPPORT” on the ballot paper; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fold the ballot paper so that the marked side is inside before leaving the voting compartment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: put the folded ballot paper into the ballot box; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: leave the polling station as soon as the ballot paper is put into the ballot box.

subsection.content: Except where it is provided otherwise in this Regulation, no person shall remove a ballot paper from a polling station. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

section.name: s37
section.heading: Marking of ballot paper for or by incapacitated person

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer, the Deputy Presiding Officer or any Assistant Presiding Officer may, upon the request of an elector who claims that he is unable to read or is incapacitated from casting his vote due to impaired eyesight or other physical cause—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mark a ballot paper for the elector according to the choice of the elector; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fold and put the ballot paper in the ballot box,

subsection.continued: in accordance with paragraphs (a), (b), (c) and (d) of section 36(1) in the presence of a polling officer designated by the Presiding Officer, the Deputy Presiding Officer or Assistant Presiding Officer, as the case may be, having regard to the choice (if any) of a candidate or his polling agent.

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer shall cause a template to be made available upon request by an elector.
A template made available to an elector under subsection (2) shall be so constructed so as to be able to facilitate an elector suffering from impaired eyesight to mark a ballot paper.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Issue a ballot paper marked “TENDERED”

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2) and section 35, if a person (the first-mentioned person) representing himself to be a particular elector applies for a ballot paper after a ballot paper has been issued on the basis that the person to whom it is issued is that elector, the Presiding Officer shall issue to the first-mentioned person a ballot paper endorsed on the front of it with the words “TENDERED” and “重複”.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer may issue a ballot paper under subsection (1) only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is not certain that the first-mentioned person is the person who has been issued with a ballot paper earlier; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the first-mentioned person answers the appropriate questions set out in section 32(2) to his satisfaction.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Marking “UNUSED” on ballot paper
section.leadIn: The Presiding Officer must, as far as reasonably practicable, endorse the words “UNUSED” and “未用” on a ballot paper that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been put into a ballot box.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Marking “SPOILT” on ballot paper

subsection.leadIn: If an elector issued with a ballot paper—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inadvertently deals with it in such a manner that it cannot be properly used as a ballot paper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes an error in marking it,

subsection.continued: he may apply to the Presiding Officer for another ballot paper.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer may issue another ballot paper to an elector referred to in subsection (1) if the elector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: returns the ballot paper already issued to him to the Presiding Officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: establishes to the satisfaction of the Presiding Officer the circumstances referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b). (L.N. 279 of 2001)

subsection.content: The Presiding Officer shall immediately cancel a ballot paper returned to him under subsection (2) by endorsing the words “SPOILT” and “損壞” on the front of the ballot paper and keep it in his custody.
For the purposes of this Regulation, issuing a ballot paper under subsection (2) shall be regarded as issuing a ballot paper under section 34(1).

section.name: s41
section.heading: Steps to be taken at a polling station after the close of the poll

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the close of voting at a polling station, the Presiding Officer shall— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: seal the ballot box with a sealing device provided for that purpose by the Chief Electoral Officer so that nothing can be put into or withdrawn from the ballot box after it is sealed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: make up into separate sealed packets—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot papers that have been issued;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the ballot papers that have not been issued;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the unused ballot papers;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the spoilt ballot papers; and
if the copy of the final register has been marked under section 34(3)(a)—the marked copy, (14 of 2021 s. 236)

subsection.continued: in the presence of the persons who are present within the polling station.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after complying with subsection (1), the Presiding Officer shall deliver—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sealed ballot box;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sealed packets referred to in subsection (1)(b); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ballot paper account,

subsection.continued: to the Returning Officer at the counting station.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Ballot paper account
section.leadIn: The Presiding Officer shall prepare a statement which shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: show the number of ballot papers supplied under section 22(2) and account for those ballot papers under the following heads—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the number of ballot papers estimated by the Presiding Officer to be in the ballot box;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the number of ballot papers which have not been issued;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the number of unused ballot papers; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the number of the spoilt ballot papers.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Determination and notice of time of counting of votes

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall determine the time at which the counting of the votes is to begin.

subsection.leadIn: The time determined under subsection (1) shall be— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a contested election, a time after the close of the relevant round of voting at all polling stations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, a time after the close of voting at all polling stations. (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), the Returning Officer shall give notice in writing to each candidate or the election agent or any counting agent appointed by him of— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address of the counting station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time determined under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Notice under subsection (3) shall be given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the counting of the votes for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a postponed poll; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a poll on a date fixed under section 17(3),

paragraph.continued: as soon as practicable after the determination of the time under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a postponement or adjournment of the counting of the votes, as soon as practicable after the determination of the time under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, at least 10 days before the time determined under subsection (1). (L.N. 209 of 2006; 15 of 2016 s. 65)

subsection.content: If the Returning Officer considers that it is impracticable to give notice under subsection (3) of the time determined under subsection (1) in respect of the counting of the votes for the fourth or any subsequent round of voting, he may dispense with the notice and announce the time through radio or television broadcast.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Appointment of counting agent

subsection.content: A candidate may appoint not more than 2 persons as his counting agents to observe the counting of the votes. (L.N. 209 of 2006)
Only a holder of an identity card who has attained the age of 18 years may be appointed as a counting agent.

subsection.leadIn: An appointment of a counting agent is effective only if a notice of appointment is delivered to the Returning Officer— (15 of 2016 s. 46)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission at least 7 days before the polling date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the candidate, or the election agent of the candidate, in person on the polling date. (15 of 2016 s. 46)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appointment shall—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state the name, identity card number and address of the counting agent; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be signed by the candidate and the counting agent.

subsection.content: If the appointment of a counting agent is revoked, the candidate must give notice of the revocation to the Returning Officer in accordance with subsection (6A) or (6B). (15 of 2016 s. 46)

subsection.leadIn: A notice of revocation shall be—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in specified form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: signed by the candidate.

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: If the notice of revocation is given before the polling date, it must be delivered to the Returning Officer by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission. (15 of 2016 s. 46)

subsection.name: 6B
subsection.content: If the notice of revocation is given on the polling date, it must be delivered to the Returning Officer by the candidate, or the election agent of the candidate, in person. (15 of 2016 s. 46)
If the appointment of a counting agent is revoked, the candidate may, subject to this section, appoint another person as a counting agent to replace the first-mentioned agent.

The appointment of or revocation of the appointment of a counting agent is not effective until the notice of appointment or notice of revocation, as the case may be, is received by the Returning Officer.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Appointment of counting officers

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may appoint such number of counting officers as he thinks fit to assist the Returning Officer in counting the votes.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer may, with reasonable cause, revoke at any time any appointment made under subsection (1). (L.N. 209 of 2006)
The Chief Electoral Officer shall display a list of the names of the counting officers in a prominent place inside the counting station.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Admission to counting station

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), no person other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a counting officer;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a candidate;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an election agent;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an elector;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a counting agent;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a public officer on duty at the counting station;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a member of the Civil Aid Service on duty at the counting station; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: ka
paragraph.content: a police officer on duty at the counting station; or (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: a person authorized under subsection (2),

subsection.continued: may enter or stay in the counting station.

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer or a member of the Commission may authorize any person in writing to enter and stay in the counting station in accordance with the terms of the authorization.

subsection.leadIn: Any member of the public may observe the counting of the votes from an area at the counting station set apart for that purpose by the Returning Officer unless the Returning Officer considers that his presence may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause disorder or disturbance in the counting station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disrupt the counting of the votes; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prejudice the secrecy of the individual votes.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall ensure that the arrangements for the counting of the votes at the counting station are such that the candidates and their respective election agents or counting agents are able to observe how individual votes are counted.
The Returning Officer may set apart an area within the counting station as a counting zone.

subsection.leadIn: Where a counting zone is set apart under subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the zone shall be delineated and identified by such means as the Returning Officer thinks fit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an elector or a person authorized under subsection (2) may not enter or stay in the zone.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Order in the counting station

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall keep order at the counting station.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not during the relevant period— (L.N. 76 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: film;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take photograph; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make any audio or video recording,

subsection.continued: in a counting zone set apart under section 46(5) without the express permission of a member of the Commission or the Returning Officer.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: relevant period (有關期間), in relation to a counting zone, means the period commencing at the time, determined under section 43, at which the counting of the votes is to begin at the zone and ending upon the completion of the counting and re-count, if any, at the zone. (L.N. 76 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fail to comply with a lawful direction given by the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, display any propaganda material relating to any candidate or the election of the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: use a sound amplifying system or device for any purpose without lawful authority or the express permission of the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: disrupt the counting of the votes or disturb or cause inconvenience to any person; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: otherwise misconduct himself,

subsection.continued: in the counting station.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person contravenes subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer reasonably considers that, having regard to the conduct of a person, the person’s presence at the counting station is for a purpose other than that for which such presence is permitted or authorized,

subsection.continued: the Returning Officer may—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require the person to produce his identity card for inspection; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: order the person to leave the counting station immediately.

subsection.content: No person shall fail to produce his identity card when required to do so under subsection (4).
If a person fails to leave when ordered to do so under subsection (4), he may be removed by a police officer or a person authorized in writing by the Returning Officer.
A person who is removed under subsection (6) may not enter the counting station again on the same day except with the permission of the Returning Officer.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Opening the ballot box

subsection.content: The Returning Officer shall open a ballot box delivered to him under section 41(2) by breaking the sealing device in the presence of the candidates or their election agents or counting agents, if present in the counting station.

If any candidate or his election agent or counting agent requests inspection of any paper (other than a ballot paper) taken from the ballot box, the Returning Officer shall allow him to inspect such paper before disposing of it.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Counting of votes

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: After opening all ballot boxes in accordance with section 48, the Returning Officer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the counting zone—

subparagraph.content: verify the number of DPS ballot papers recorded under subparagraph (i) by comparing it with the ballot paper account of the dedicated polling station; and (14 of 2021 s. 237)
prepare a written statement about the result of the verification; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after preparing the statement under paragraph (a)(iii) but before the counting of votes under subsection (1), mix the DPS ballot papers with the ballot papers in at least one of the ballot boxes from the main polling station. (1 of 2019 s. 61)

subsection.leadIn: All ballot papers must then be— (L.N. 133 of 2009; 1 of 2019 s. 61)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sorted according to the choices marked on them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: placed in separate boxes; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: counted manually.

subsection.leadIn: In the course of sorting and counting in accordance with subsection (1)— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any ballot paper which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: appears to have on it any writing or mark by which the elector can possibly be identified;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: appears to be substantially mutilated;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: appears to be not marked in accordance with section 36(1)(b); or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: appears to be void for uncertainty,

paragraph.continued: shall be separated and forwarded to the Returning Officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any ballot paper described in section 50(1)(b), (c), (d), (f) or (ga) shall be separated. (L.N. 209 of 2006; 1 of 2019 s. 61)

section.name: s50
section.heading: Some ballot papers invalid

subsection.leadIn: Upon counting of votes, a ballot paper of any of the following descriptions shall not be valid and the vote recorded on the ballot paper shall not be counted— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on which there is any writing or mark by which the elector can possibly be identified; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which has the words “TENDERED” and “重複” endorsed on it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which has the words “SPOILT” and “損壞” endorsed on it;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: which has the words “UNUSED” and “未用” endorsed on it;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: which is substantially mutilated;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: which is unmarked;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: which is not marked in accordance with section 36(1)(b);

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.leadIn: on which—

subparagraph.content: for a contested election—votes for more than one candidate are recorded; or
for an uncontested election—both “SUPPORT” and “NOT SUPPORT” votes are recorded; (1 of 2019 s. 62)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: which the Returning Officer determines as being void for uncertainty. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: A candidate, an election agent or a counting agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may inspect a ballot paper described in subsection (1)(b), (c), (d), (f) or (ga); but (1 of 2019 s. 62)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not entitled to make representations to the Returning Officer concerning the ballot paper. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

section.name: s51
section.heading: Determination of validity of questionable ballot papers

subsection.leadIn: If a ballot paper is forwarded to the Returning Officer under section 49(2)(a), a candidate or his election agent or counting agent, if present within the counting station, is entitled to— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect the ballot paper; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make representations to the Returning Officer concerning the ballot paper.

subsection.leadIn: After considering the representations (if any) made under subsection (1), the Returning Officer shall determine whether the ballot paper—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is valid and the vote shall be counted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be valid under section 50(1).

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 50(1)(g), the Returning Officer may determine a ballot paper which is not marked in accordance with section 36(1)(b) as valid under subsection (2) and the vote shall be counted if, subject to other provisions of section 50(1), he is satisfied that the elector has marked the ballot paper by affixing the chop issued under section 34(1) on the ballot paper so as to clearly indicate his intention to vote for the candidate concerned.

subsection.leadIn: If the Returning Officer determines that a ballot paper shall not be valid, he shall— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: endorse the words “rejected” and “不獲接納” on the front of it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where any candidate, election agent or counting agent objects to the determination, endorse the words “rejection objected to” and “反對此選票不獲接納” on the front of it.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer determines that a ballot paper is valid and the vote shall be counted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any candidate, election agent or counting agent objects to the determination,

subsection.continued: the Returning Officer shall endorse the words “acceptance objected to” and “反對此選票獲接納” on the front of the ballot paper.

subsection.content: A determination made under subsection (2) shall be final.

section.name: s51A
section.heading: Returning Officer to prepare ballot paper statement

subsection.content: The Returning Officer is to prepare a statement of the ballot papers that are not counted.

subsection.leadIn: The statement is to be made under the following heads—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ballot paper has on it any writing or mark by which the elector can possibly be identified;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is endorsed with the words “TENDERED” and “重複”;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is endorsed with the words “UNUSED” and “未用”;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is endorsed with the words “SPOILT” and “損壞”;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is substantially mutilated;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is unmarked;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the ballot paper is not marked by affixing an issued chop;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the ballot paper is one on which—

subparagraph.content: for a contested election—votes for more than one candidate are recorded; or
for an uncontested election—both “SUPPORT” and “NOT SUPPORT” votes are recorded;

paragraph.content: the ballot paper is void for uncertainty.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Verification of number of ballot papers

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer must, after the counting of votes in accordance with section 49— (1 of 2019 s. 65)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: record the number of— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a contested election, valid votes obtained by each candidate; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, valid “SUPPORT” and “NOT SUPPORT” votes obtained by the candidate; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: record the number of ballot papers which are not valid under section 50(1); (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: verify the numbers recorded under paragraphs (a) and (b) by comparing them with the ballot paper account of the main polling station; and (14 of 2021 s. 238)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prepare a statement in writing as to the result of the verification.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer considers it necessary to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a candidate, an election agent or a counting agent present within the counting station so requests,

subsection.continued: the Returning Officer must, in preparing a verification statement under section 49(1A)(a)(iii) or subsection (1)(d), compare the ballot paper account of the polling station concerned with the number of ballot papers recorded by him and the unused ballot papers, the spoilt ballot papers, the ballot papers that have not been issued and counterfoils of ballot papers that have been issued.

subsection.leadIn: A candidate, an election agent or a counting agent may copy what is recorded on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ballot paper account; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a verification statement.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Result of counting and re-count

subsection.leadIn: After the votes are counted and the number of ballot papers verified, the Returning Officer shall— (L.N. 133 of 2009; 14 of 2021 s. 239)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: make known the result of the counting to—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the election agent or any counting agent (if present) of a candidate who is not present; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give them a reasonable opportunity to make a request under subsection (2).

subsection.content: A candidate or an election agent who is present may request the Returning Officer to count again the counted or re-counted votes.
The Returning Officer shall comply with a request under subsection (2) unless he is of the opinion that the request is unreasonable.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Notice of further round of voting

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an election in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are 3 or more candidates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: after the completion of the counting of the votes cast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: no candidate obtains more than 750 votes; and (14 of 2021 s. 240)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: 2 or more candidates remain after the elimination of all other candidates under section 27(3)(c) or (4)(c) of the Election Ordinance. (L.N. 76 of 2011)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If subsection (1) applies, the Returning Officer must by an announcement declare— (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 76 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the poll shall proceed to the next round of voting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who are the remaining candidates in the next round of voting.

subsection.leadIn: An announcement under subsection (1A) must be— (L.N. 76 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: broadcast on radio and television as soon as practicable after the completion of the counting of the votes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made in such manner as the Returning Officer thinks fit.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Notice of election result
section.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after declaring the election result under section 28(1)(a) or (2)(a) of the Election Ordinance— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: display a notice of the result of the election at a prominent place immediately outside the counting station; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: send a notice of the result of the election to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chairman of the Commission;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs; and (L.N. 130 of 2007)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer.

editorialNote.content: For the saving and transitional provisions relating to the amendments made by the Resolution of the Legislative Council (L.N. 130 of 2007), see paragraph (12) of that Resolution.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Ballot papers to be sealed

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after terminating the proceedings for the election under section 22(1AB)(e) or (3)(e) of the Election Ordinance or declaring the result of the election under section 28(1)(a) or (2)(a) of that Ordinance, make up into separate sealed packets— (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 76 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the counted ballot papers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot paper that have been issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ballot papers that have not been issued; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ballot papers that are not valid under section 50(1).

subsection.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall endorse on each sealed packet—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of its contents;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the polling date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a contested election, the number of the relevant round of voting.

subsection.content: A candidate, an election agent or a counting agent may be present when the Returning Officer makes up the sealed packets and endorses them.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Ballot papers, accounts, packets, etc. to be sent to Chief Electoral Officer
section.leadIn: The Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after discharging his duties under section 56, send to the Chief Electoral Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ballot paper accounts; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the statement prepared under section 51A(1); (1 of 2019 s. 66)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the verification statement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the sealed packets made up under section 56(1);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a copy of the notice referred to in section 55(b);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: all nomination forms delivered to him in accordance with section 4(1);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: all notices of withdrawal (if any) delivered to him in accordance with section 9(2);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: all notices of appointment given to him under section 14(2) or 44(3);

paragraph.name: i
1a
paragraph.content: if the copy of the final register has been marked under section 34(3)(a)—the marked copy; and (14 of 2021 s. 241)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: any other document relating to the election specified by the Commission.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Inspection of ballot paper kept by the Chief Electoral Officer
section.content: The Chief Electoral Officer shall not permit any person to inspect any ballot paper sent to him under section 57 other than on an order made by a court in proceedings relating to an election petition or other legal proceedings.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Retention of election documents

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: retain in his custody the documents sent to him under section 57 and the copies or extracts of the final register in which records have been made under section 34(3)(b) for 6 months from— (L.N. 209 of 2006; 14 of 2021 s. 242)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the declaration of the result of the election to which they relate under section 28(1)(a) or (2)(a) of the Election Ordinance,

paragraph.continued: as may be applicable; and (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless otherwise directed by an order of court in proceedings relating to an election petition or other legal proceedings, destroy the documents, copies and extracts after the expiry of those 6 months. (14 of 2021 s. 242)

part.name: P8
part.heading: Termination, Postponement or Adjournment of Proceedings

section.name: s60
section.heading: Procedure after termination of election proceedings

subsection.content: A declaration of termination of the proceedings for the election made under section 22(1AA), (1AB)(e), (1) or (3)(e) of the Election Ordinance shall be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable. (L.N. 76 of 2011)

subsection.leadIn: If a declaration of termination of the proceedings for the election is made under section 22(1AA) or (1) of the Election Ordinance— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the polling date, the Presiding Officer of a polling station shall display a notice of the declaration at a prominent place immediately outside the polling station as soon as practicable; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: during voting or a round of voting (as may be appropriate), the Presiding Officer shall— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: open the ballot box; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: all ballot papers (whether issued or not) made up into a sealed packet;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the ballot box (whether used or not); and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: all other materials supplied to him by the Chief Electoral Officer for the purpose of the poll,

paragraph.continued: and the Commissioner of Correctional Services or the head of a law enforcement agency shall, as soon as practicable, inform all electors in custody detained by him who have not yet voted in the poll of the declaration; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: after the close of the poll but before the declaration of the result of the election, the Presiding Officer shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the ballot box has not been opened, open the ballot box; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: all ballot papers (whether issued or not) made up into a sealed packet;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the ballot box; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: all other materials supplied to him by the Chief Electoral Officer for the purpose of the poll.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If a declaration of termination of the proceedings for the election is made under section 22(1AB)(e) or (3)(e) of the Election Ordinance, the Returning Officer shall display a notice of the declaration at a prominent place immediately outside the counting station as soon as practicable. (L.N. 209 of 2006; L. N. 76 of 2011)

Sections 58 and 59 apply to the ballot papers and other materials delivered to the Returning Officer under subsection (2)(b)(ii) or (c)(ii) as if they are ballot papers and documents sent to the Chief Electoral Officer under section 57. (L.N. 279 of 2001)

section.name: s61
section.heading: Postponement or adjournment of polling or counting of votes

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may direct—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the postponement of a poll if, before the commencement of polling, the Commission is of the opinion that the poll; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the postponement of the counting of the votes in respect of a poll if, before the commencement of the counting, the Commission is of the opinion that the counting,

subsection.continued: is likely to be obstructed, disrupted, undermined or seriously affected by—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a typhoon or other climatic condition of a serious nature; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an occurrence which appears to the Commission to be a material irregularity relating to the election, the poll or the counting.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may direct—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the adjournment of a poll if, during the polling, the Commission is of the opinion that the poll; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the adjournment of the counting of the votes in respect of a poll if, during the counting, the Commission is of the opinion that the counting,

subsection.continued: is likely to be or is being obstructed, disrupted, undermined or seriously affected by—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a typhoon or other climatic condition of a serious nature; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an occurrence which appears to the Commission to be a material irregularity relating to the election, the poll or the counting.

subsection.content: An elector who has cast a vote at a poll adjourned under subsection (2) is not entitled and shall not be allowed to cast a vote again at the resumed polling.
Subsection (3) ceases to apply, in the case of a contested election, if the poll proceeds to another round of voting. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

section.name: s62
section.heading: Publication of postponement or adjournment of polling or counting
section.leadIn: If the Commission directs the postponement or adjournment of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a poll; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the counting of the votes in respect of a poll,

section.continued: it shall publish the direction in such manner as it considers practicable.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Procedure after adjournment of polling

subsection.leadIn: If the Commission directs the adjournment of a poll, the Presiding Officer shall, as soon as practicable after receiving the direction, make up into packets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the counterfoils of the ballot papers that have been issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ballot papers that have not been issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the unused ballot papers;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the spoilt ballot papers; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the copy of the final register has been marked under section 34(3)(a)—the marked copy, (14 of 2021 s. 243)

subsection.continued: in the presence of the persons who are present within the polling station.

subsection.leadIn: The Presiding Officer shall, as soon as practicable after complying with subsection (1), deliver—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sealed ballot box; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the packets referred to in subsection (1),

subsection.continued: to the Returning Officer.

subsection.leadIn: If it is impracticable to make delivery under subsection (2), the Presiding Officer shall deposit the items in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a safe place within the polling station;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no safe place referred to in paragraph (a), a safe place within a police station or a public building close to the polling station; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if there is no safe place referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b), a safe place within a secure building close to the polling station,

subsection.continued: until the delivery becomes practicable.

subsection.leadIn: Upon the delivery to the Returning Officer of the ballot box and sealed packets under subsection (2), he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: take such steps as determined by the Commission for the purpose of ensuring the safety and security of the ballot box and sealed packets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remain in charge of the ballot box and sealed packets and be responsible for their safety and security until the resumption of the poll.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Procedure after postponement or adjournment of counting
section.leadIn: If the counting of the votes is postponed or adjourned, the Returning Officer shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (in the case of adjournment) cease the counting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: deposit the ballot box (whether opened or not), the ballot papers (whether counted or not), the verification statement, all other items delivered to him under section 41(2) and such other documents relating to the election as he thinks fit in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a safe place within the counting station;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is no safe place referred to in subparagraph (i), a safe place within a police station or a public building close to the counting station; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if there is no safe place referred to in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), a safe place within a secure building close to the counting station;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take such steps as determined by the Commission for the purpose of ensuring the safety and security of the items so deposited; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: remain in charge of the items so deposited and be responsible for their safety and security until the resumption of the counting of the votes.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Resumption of postponed or adjourned polling or counting

subsection.content: If a poll is postponed, the Commission shall appoint a date within 14 days after the date of the postponed poll as the new polling date.

subsection.leadIn: If a poll is adjourned, the Commission shall appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a date within 14 days after the date of the adjourned poll as the date on which the polling shall resume; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 17(5), the polling hours for the resumed polling.

subsection.content: If the counting of the votes is postponed, the Commission shall appoint a date within 14 days after the date of the postponed counting as the date on which the counting shall be conducted.
If the counting of the votes is adjourned, the Commission shall appoint a date within 14 days after the date of the adjourned counting as the date on which the counting shall resume.
A date appointed under subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) shall be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after the appointment.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Certain officers cannot act as candidate’s agent
section.leadIn: The Returning Officer, an Assistant Returning Officer, a Presiding Officer, a polling officer or a counting officer shall not act as— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the election agent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an election expense agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a polling agent; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a counting agent,

section.continued: in relation to the election for which he is appointed.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Employees of candidates shall not act as electoral officers
section.leadIn: No person shall, while in the employment of a candidate in an election, act as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a Presiding Officer; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a polling officer; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a counting officer,

section.name: s67A
section.heading: Certain visitors of electors in custody not to canvass for votes

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person (visitor) visits in a certain capacity an elector in custody for a business or official purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another person who is not acting in that capacity is not allowed to visit the elector for that purpose,

subsection.continued: the visitor commits an offence if he, during the visit, canvasses for votes for the purpose of an election.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Act done in the absence of candidates or agents still valid
section.leadIn: If an act is required or authorized under this Regulation to be done in the presence of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a candidate or all candidates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an election agent, a polling agent or a counting agent,

section.continued: that act shall not be invalid solely for the reason that such person or persons are not present when the act is performed.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Declaration of secrecy

subsection.leadIn: Except a person to whom subsection (2) applies, no person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter a polling station or the counting station without making a declaration of secrecy in the specified form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stay in a polling station or the counting station without carrying with him the declaration of secrecy.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a child permitted to enter the main polling station under section 26(2);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a police officer, an officer of the Correctional Services Department or an officer of any law enforcement agency on duty at a polling station or the counting station, as the case may be;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a member of the Civil Aid Service on duty at the main polling station or the counting station, as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person who enters or stays in the counting station by virtue of section 46(3). (L.N. 279 of 2001)

subsection.leadIn: A declaration of secrecy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Returning Officer shall be made in the presence of a commissioner defined in section 2 of the Oaths and Declarations Ordinance (Cap. 11); (L.N. 279 of 2001)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by any other person shall be made in the presence of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Returning Officer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a member of the Commission; (L.N. 279 of 2001)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a justice of the peace; (L.N. 279 of 2001)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a commissioner referred to in paragraph (a); or (L.N. 279 of 2001)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer. (L.N. 279 of 2001)

section.name: s70
section.heading: Secrecy

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), divulge to any person whether an elector has or has not applied for a ballot paper or voted;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), divulge to any other person the identity of an elector in custody; (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: communicate to another person any information obtained at the counting of the votes as to— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a contested election, the candidate for whom a vote has been given on any particular ballot paper; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, the choice as to whether to support the candidate on any particular ballot paper; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: interfere with an elector when he is marking the ballot paper;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: interfere with or attempt to interfere with a ballot box, a ballot paper (including a ballot paper that is not valid under section 50(1)), a copy of the final register in printed form, a statement prepared under section 51A(1) or a verification statement; (L.N. 209 of 2006; 1 of 2019 s. 67; 14 of 2021 s. 244)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: without the permission of the Commission or the Returning Officer, obtain or attempt to obtain in any manner within a polling station, a no canvassing zone or a no staying zone information as to— (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 133 of 2009)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a contested election, the candidate for whom an elector is about to vote or has voted; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, the choice as to whether to support the candidate which an elector is about to make or has made; (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: communicate to another person any information obtained in a polling station as to— (L.N. 209 of 2006; L.N. 133 of 2009)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a contested election, the candidate for whom an elector is about to vote or has voted; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, the choice as to whether to support the candidate which an elector is about to make or has made; or (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: directly or indirectly induce an elector to display a ballot paper marked by the elector so as to make known to any person any information as to— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a contested election, the candidate for whom the elector has voted; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, the choice as to whether to support the candidate which the elector has made. (L.N. 209 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(a) and (aa) does not apply to— (L.N. 133 of 2009)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any act authorized by law; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: anything done at the direction of a police officer or an officer of the Independent Commission Against Corruption investigating an offence under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sections 3, 4 and 8 of the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: section 13B of the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204); or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: this Ordinance.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Declaration and undertaking concerning political affiliation

subsection.content: A statutory declaration and written undertaking referred to in section 31(1)(a) and (b) of the Election Ordinance shall be in specified form.
The Returning Officer shall deliver a written undertaking lodged with him under section 31(1)(b) of the Election Ordinance to the Commission.
The Commission shall retain in its custody a written undertaking delivered to it under subsection (2).

section.name: s72
section.heading: Manner of giving notice

subsection.leadIn: Notices under the following provisions may be delivered by hand, by post, by electronic mail or by facsimile transmission— (15 of 2016 s. 47)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 7(1) (determination of validity of nomination);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 15(1) (notice to candidates of the appointment of election agents);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 19(1) (polling notice);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 23(2) (boundary of the no canvassing zone and no staying zone);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: section 23(4) (variation of the no canvassing zone and no staying zone);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: section 31(4) (allocation of candidate numbers by drawing of lots); or (15 of 2016 s. 47)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: section 43(3) (time and place of the counting of votes). (15 of 2016 s. 47)

subsection.content: A notice under section 23(4) may be given orally if sending it in accordance with subsection (1) is not practicable or is not suitable in the circumstances.

section.name: s72A
section.heading: Election return to be lodged in specified form
section.content: The election return required to be lodged under section 37 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554) in respect of an election must be in the specified form (if any).

section.name: s73
section.heading: Commission to specify forms

subsection.content: The Commission may specify forms for the purposes of the provisions of this Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: Forms specified under subsection (1) shall be made available by the Chief Electoral Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during ordinary business hours at his office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: free of charge.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to the specified form referred to in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 15(1) (notice to candidates of the appointment of election agents);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 19(1) (polling notice); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 42 (ballot paper account).

section.name: s74
section.heading: Misnomer or inaccuracy does not affect election documents
section.leadIn: A misnomer or inaccurate description of a person, a person’s identity document or a place specified in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the final register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a nomination form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a ballot paper;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a notice that may be or is required to be given or sent under the Election Ordinance or this Regulation; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other document that may be or is required to be prepared or produced under the Election Ordinance or this Regulation,

section.continued: shall not limit its full operation with respect to that person, identity document or place if the description of the person, identity document or place is such as to be commonly understood.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Defect in appointment of officers does not affect election
section.content: An election shall not be questioned only because of a defect in the appointment of a person as an electoral officer if the person was at the relevant time holding office or acting as such an officer at the election.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Limit on the Returning Officer’s power to delegate
section.leadIn: The Returning Officer may not delegate to an Assistant Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a determination under section 51(2); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the declaration of the result of an election under section 28 of the Election Ordinance.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Chief Electoral Officer’s functions, powers and duties

subsection.content: The Chief Electoral Officer is subject to the directions of the Commission in the performance of his functions under this Regulation.
The Chief Electoral Officer may delegate his powers, duties or functions under this Regulation to a member of the staff provided under section 9(3) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Elector need not disclose vote

subsection.leadIn: An elector who is asked to disclose— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a contested election, the name of, or any particulars relating to, the candidate for whom the elector has voted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an uncontested election, whether the elector has cast a “SUPPORT” or “NOT SUPPORT” vote for the candidate,

subsection.continued: is not required to answer the question.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall require or purport to require, without lawful authority— (L.N. 209 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an elector in a contested election to disclose the name of, or any particulars relating to, the candidate for whom the elector has voted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an elector in an uncontested election to disclose whether the elector has cast a “SUPPORT” or “NOT SUPPORT” vote for the candidate.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Reporting of irregularities

subsection.content: If the Returning Officer, the Chief Electoral Officer or a Presiding Officer is of the opinion that an irregularity has occurred in relation to an election, a poll or a count, he shall make a report in writing to the Commission. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: A report of an irregularity shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after the Officer concerned becomes aware of it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any case not later than 14 days after the polling date.

subsection.content: If in the opinion of the Returning Officer, the Chief Electoral Officer or a Presiding Officer a material irregularity has occurred or is likely to occur in relation to an election, he shall immediately make a report to the Commission in such manner as he considers expedient in the circumstances. (L.N. 133 of 2009)

subsection.leadIn: If a report is made under subsection (3) otherwise than in writing, the Officer concerned shall make a report also in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after the making of the first-mentioned report; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any case not later than 30 days after the polling date.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Provisions relating to free postage by candidates

subsection.leadIn: A letter that may be sent free of postage by a candidate under section 45 of the Election Ordinance shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be posted in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain materials relating only to his candidature;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: be not larger than 165 mm × 245 mm and not smaller than 90 mm × 140 mm in size; and (11 of 2019 s. 23)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not exceed 5 mm in thickness at any part of the letter. (11 of 2019 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: If letters are sent in a bulk mailing by a candidate under section 45 of the Election Ordinance, he shall provide the Postmaster General with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specimen of the materials contained in that bulk mailing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a declaration in the specified form signed by the candidate stating that the materials contained in that bulk mailing are identical with that specimen.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a declaration made by a candidate under subsection (2)(b) is false in any particular,

subsection.continued: the candidate is liable for payment of postage for all the letters in that bulk mailing.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Offence

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes section 24(2), (4), (6) or (8), 26(1), 27(2), (5), (7), (9) or (11), 46(1), 47(2), (3), (5) or (7), 66 or 67 commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

Any person who contravenes section 27(4), 70(1) or 78(2) commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 76 of 2011 and L.N. 124 of 2011; 11 of 2012 s. 17)

section.name: s83
section.heading: Offences by electoral officer

subsection.content: Any person holding office as an electoral officer at an election who neglects or refuses to perform the functions or duties of that office in relation to the election commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.
A prosecution for an offence under this section may be brought only with the consent of the Secretary for Justice.
A person shall not be liable to conviction under this section unless the complaint or information alleging the offence is made or laid within 3 months after the date of the alleged offence.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Offence of false statement

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement which he knows to be false in a material particular in an election related document;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: omits a material particular in an election related document,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Any person (the first-mentioned person) who directly or indirectly by himself or by another person on his behalf conspires with, incites, compels, induces, coerces, intimidates or persuade, any other person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a false statement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide information which the first-mentioned person knows to be wrong in a material particular,

subsection.continued: in an election related document commits an offence.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under this section is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
An offence under subsection (1) or (2) shall be an offence referred to in section 14(h)(iv) of the Election Ordinance.
The provisions of this section are made for the purposes of section 14(h) of the Election Ordinance.

subsection.def: In this section election related document (與選舉有關的文件) means a form, declaration, application, notice, statement or nomination form required or used for the purposes of the Election Ordinance or this Regulation.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Application of Parts 4 to 9
section.content: In relation to the poll in a contested election, the provisions of Parts 4 to 9 apply to and in relation to every round of voting in a poll.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 10)

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: Court (法院) means the Court of First Instance;

def.name: ElectionPeriod
def.leadIn: election period (選舉期), in relation to an election, means the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the first day of the nomination period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: ending on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the day on which a declaration is made under section 22 of the Election Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the day on which the polling ends;

subsection.def: publish (發布) means print, display, exhibit, distribute, post up, publicly announce or make publicly known by any other means, and includes continue to publish.

subsection.content: Any person who authorizes the publication of an election advertisement is taken to have published the advertisement for the purposes of this Part.
If the Returning Officer has not been appointed, any reference in this Part to the Returning Officer is to be construed as a reference to the Chief Electoral Officer.

subsection.leadIn: A document published by a candidate during an election period that gives details of the work done by the candidate in the capacity of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: a member of the Election Committee; (14 of 2021 s. 246)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a member of a District Council;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a member of the Heung Yee Kuk;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Chairman or Vice-Chairman or a member of the Executive Committee of a Rural Committee within the meaning of section 3(3)(a) of the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance (Cap. 1097); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a Rural Representative, (5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.continued: is an election advertisement for the purposes of this Part.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Requirements applicable to election advertisements

subsection.leadIn: A candidate who publishes an election advertisement must comply with subsection (2) or (3) in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the advertisement and any information related to the advertisement required by the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the publication is by means of displaying the advertisement in the form of a bill or poster within the meaning of section 104E(4) of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132), the permission obtained for the purposes of section 104A(1) of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is of a kind referred to in subsection (1) or (2) of section 27 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554), the consent referred to in subsection (1A), (1B), (2A) or (2B) of that section.

subsection.leadIn: A candidate must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make an electronic copy of the advertisement, information, permission or consent available for inspection on an open platform maintained by the Chief Electoral Officer or a person authorized by the Chief Electoral Officer (Central Platform) in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make an electronic copy of the advertisement, information, permission or consent available for inspection on an open platform maintained by the candidate or a person authorized by the candidate (Candidate’s Platform) in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission until the end of the period for which copies of election returns are available for inspection under section 41 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554) and provide information about the Candidate’s Platform required by the Commission in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Commission considers that it is technically impracticable to make available for inspection on the Central Platform or a Candidate’s Platform an election advertisement published through the Internet by means of an open platform, provide a hyperlink to that open platform on the Central Platform or Candidate’s Platform in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: A candidate must provide, in the manner and within the time specified by the Commission, to the Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information and 2 copies of the advertisement in paper form or any other form specified by the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a hard copy of the permission or consent.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not publish a printed election advertisement that fails to show, in the English or Chinese language—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the printer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which it was printed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of copies printed.

subsection.content: Subsection (4) does not apply to an election advertisement that is printed in a newspaper registered under section 7 of the Registration of Local Newspapers Ordinance (Cap. 268).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) does not apply to the publication of a printed election advertisement if, not later than 7 days after the advertisement is published, the publisher, or a person authorized by the publisher, has provided to the Returning Officer a statutory declaration that states—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the printer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which it was printed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of copies printed.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer must make available for public inspection a copy of each of any advertisement, information, permission, consent or statutory declaration provided under subsection (3) or (6) from when it is provided until the end of the period for which copies of election returns are available for inspection under section 41 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).

The Chief Electoral Officer must publicize any platform maintained under subsection (2)(a) and ensure that the platform is maintained until the end of the period for which copies of election returns are available for inspection under section 41 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).
A person who fails to comply with subsection (1) or (4) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Court may grant relief for election advertisements

subsection.content: A person who publishes an election advertisement without complying with section 87(1)(a) or (4) may apply to the Court for an order under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of an application made under subsection (1), the Court may make an order excepting the act which would, but for the order, constitute an offence under subsection (9) of section 87, from the relevant requirement under that section, but only if the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the non-compliance was due to inadvertence, an accidental miscalculation or any reasonable cause and was not due to bad faith; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the Court requires notice of the application to be given in Hong Kong, the notice has been given; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: believes it to be just that the act be so excepted.

subsection.content: If an application is made under subsection (1), no prosecution against the applicant for not having complied with section 87(1)(a) or (4) may be instituted or carried on until the application is disposed of by the Court.
An applicant is not liable to be convicted of an offence under section 87(9) if the non-compliance by the applicant with section 87(1)(a) or (4) is the subject of an order made under subsection (2).

section.name: s89
section.heading: Power to seize, etc. election advertisements
section.content: The Returning Officer or any person authorized by that Officer may seize and dispose of, or destroy, or obliterate, or cover with any materials that Officer or the person thinks fit, any election advertisement on display and in respect of which any requirement in section 87 has not been complied with.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Commission may grant exemption
section.content: The Commission may, by notice published in the Gazette, exempt any class or type of election advertisement from the application of any provision of section 87.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Electronic Copy or Extract of Final Register for Purposes of Section 34(3)(b)

section.name: s91
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 11)
section.def: FR electronic copy or extract (正式登記冊電子文本或摘錄) means an electronic copy or extract of the final register, or of part of the final register, created and maintained under section 92;

obtain access (取覽), in relation to an FR electronic copy or extract, includes causing an electronic device to perform a function so as to obtain access to the data or information contained in the FR electronic copy or extract.

section.name: s92
section.heading: FR electronic copy or extract

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, for the purposes of section 34(3)(b), create and maintain an electronic copy or extract of the final register, or of part of the final register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be stored on an electronic platform; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: access to which can be obtained through the Internet by using an electronic device.

subsection.content: An FR electronic copy or extract is to contain the identity document numbers of the electors and such additional particulars or information that the Chief Electoral Officer thinks fit to include.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Protection of FR electronic copy or extract

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person obtains access to an FR electronic copy or extract without legal authority to do so.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), an individual has legal authority to obtain access to an FR electronic copy or extract if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the individual is a Presiding Officer or polling officer who is authorized by the Commission to use the FR electronic copy or extract for the purposes of section 34(3)(b) and the individual so uses the FR electronic copy or extract in compliance with the terms of the authorization; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the individual is authorized by the Commission to assist in making the FR electronic copy or extract available for the use mentioned in paragraph (b) and the individual acts in compliance with the terms of the authorization.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, without lawful excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: damages any data or information contained in an FR electronic copy or extract; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise tampers with an FR electronic copy or extract to make its operation defective.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (3) is liable on conviction on indictment to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Commission may authorize access to FR electronic copy or extract

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Commission may, for the purposes of section 93(2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant an authorization to an individual; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the terms of the authorization.

subsection.leadIn: An authorization granted to an individual under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the name and appropriate identification details of the individual; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: set out the terms of the authorization.
